Title: Pocket Guide to Clinical Microbiology
Author: মুর্রে‌ প্যাট্রিক আর.
Summary: This is a pocket-sized guide for clinical microbiologists, offering immediate access to information needed every day in the lab. The book is designed to follow the lab process - from differential diagnosis to specimen collection, transport and processing, and then to identification, susceptibility testing, and finally immunodiagnostic testing. It should be a useful and time-saving resource for microbiologists.

Title: Bacterial Protein Toxins
Author: বার্নস
Summary: Designed for newcomers to the field of toxins and intended to show how proteins work and can be used in research. The text describes the biology of toxins, including their synthesis and secretion, their travels to and into the host cell and their modes of attacking the host cell machinery.

Title: Sex in Fungi : Molecular Determination and Evolutionary Implications
Author: হেইটম্যান
Summary: Drawing on the great advances made over the past 10 years, this volume provides illuminating insights into the molecular details of cell-type specification, mating-type switching, pheromone perception and signaling, and cellular and nuclear fusion.
Book_Title: Sex in Fungi : Molecular Determination and Evolutionary Implications

Title: Molecular Biology And Biotechnology: A Guide For Students
Author: ক্রেউজার
Summary: The new edition of the best-selling student edition (formerly Recombinant DNA and Biotechnology) provides students with background information and classroom activities for objectively analyzing and rationally discussing the interrelationships of science, technology, and society.
Book_Title: Molecular Biology And Biotechnology: A Guide For Students
